recent_signals.headline: Chapter 11 filings surged +76% YoY in January 2026 (956 vs 544) — sharpest acceleration in dataset
recent_signals.detail: Commercial bankruptcy filings are not just rising — they are accelerating. The 76% YoY jump represents the point in the liquidation cascade where distressed assets (customer lists, contracts, physical infrastructure) become available at depressed prices. This is the optimal entry window for P2.

recent_signals.headline: HY spread at 2.87% despite +76% bankruptcy surge — bond markets have NOT priced the distress wave
recent_signals.detail: Critical divergence signal. Bond markets pricing benign environment while operating reality shows accelerating distress. Either spreads widen or distress is concentrated in small/mid companies below bond-index radar — meaning the P2 cascade is happening in exactly the SMB tier where agentic entrants compete.

recent_signals.headline: Inference costs down ~1,000x while total AI spending up 320% — infrastructure overhang confirmed
recent_signals.detail: The defining P1 condition is met: massive infrastructure investment driving per-unit costs to near-zero. Cost-per-token replacing cost-per-hour as the primary KPI. At 1000x reduction, entire categories of businesses that were impossible at previous cost curves become viable.

recent_signals.headline: Professional & Business Services shed 97K jobs (-0.4% YoY) — early liquidation cascade in knowledge work
recent_signals.detail: Sector includes accounting, legal, consulting, staffing, IT services — labor-intensive professional services most exposed to AI cost disruption. Employment declining while broader economy adds jobs = structural, not cyclical.

recent_signals.headline: 15,000 store closures projected for 2026 — 2x the 7,325 in 2024
recent_signals.detail: Physical retail doubling closure rate. Dollar General, GameStop, specialty chains. Creates cascading distress in retail-adjacent services (commercial real estate, logistics, marketing).

recent_signals.headline: 55,000 AI-attributed layoffs in 2025 (12x prior) but based on AI potential not performance — timing arbitrage
recent_signals.detail: Companies shedding human capacity before AI can actually replace it (Amazon, UPS, Pinterest). Creates SERVICE VACUUM: quality degrades as humans exit but AI is not yet deployed. Agentic entrants who can actually deliver during this gap capture market share.

recent_signals.headline: SECTORAL DIVERGENCE: Ed/Health +709K jobs vs Prof Services -97K vs Transport -58.5K — same economy, opposite directions
recent_signals.detail: Most structurally important signal. Economy is not uniformly expanding or contracting. Healthcare cannot hire fast enough (P5). Professional services and transport are shedding workers (P2). Opportunity corridor: acquire distressed P2 assets, deploy agentic labor to serve P5 shortage sectors.

recent_signals.headline: Education & Health Services employment surges +2.6% YoY (+709K) to 27,640K — absorbing all available labor
recent_signals.detail: Healthcare is the largest labor sink in the US economy. Sector alone added more jobs than total decline in Professional Services + Transportation combined. Gap is structural and widening.

recent_signals.headline: Nursing shortage shifts from volume to specialization — critical care, mental health, primary care most needed
recent_signals.detail: California short 22% vs Wyoming oversupply 79%. AI cannot replace nurses but can shift ratios from 1:4 to 1:12 with monitoring/triage automation. Ideal P5 pattern: filling a gap humans cannot fill, with regulatory tailwind.

recent_signals.headline: Immigration enforcement fueling construction labor gaps — 92% of contractors struggling, >25% workforce foreign-born
recent_signals.detail: Policy-driven supply constraint amplifying demographic shortage. AI augmentation (project management, estimation, scheduling, compliance) can multiply existing worker productivity. Political environment makes shortage permanent for 2-4 year policy cycle.

recent_signals.headline: PE firms funding AI roll-up strategies — General Catalyst, Slow Ventures, 8VC active
recent_signals.detail: Phase 2 cascade indicator: financial sponsors recognize fragmented industries ripe for AI consolidation. The roll-up thesis itself may be disrupted — a pure agentic entrant with 10-20x cost advantage does not need to acquire and restructure.

recent_signals.headline: Commercial loans DOWN $55.8B (-2% YoY) while delinquency stable at 1.78% — credit contraction blocking restructuring
recent_signals.detail: Businesses deleveraging or denied credit. Companies needing AI transformation capital are being denied it. ACCELERATES the P2 cascade for capital-constrained incumbents.

recent_signals.headline: GPU monopoly fragmenting — Midjourney cut costs 65% via TPU migration; inference 15-20x training costs
recent_signals.detail: Compute layer commoditizing. Multiple hardware options competing on inference price. Application-layer businesses that consume cheap compute are the P1 beneficiaries.

recent_signals.headline: Edge AI/SLMs deployable on constrained devices — Microsoft Foundry Local at Build 2025
recent_signals.detail: Local inference enables use cases in low-connectivity, privacy-sensitive, latency-critical environments. Healthcare (HIPAA), construction sites, field services become viable for agentic operations without cloud costs.

recent_signals.headline: Unit labor costs declining from 123.13 to 121.64 but still +1.8% YoY — squeeze moderating, not reversing
recent_signals.detail: Squeeze that drove 2024-2025 distress is easing but labor costs remain structurally elevated. At $37.02/hr average, single employee costs ~$77K/yr. Agentic cost advantage does not disappear as squeeze moderates — it becomes permanent structural advantage.

recent_signals.headline: Average hourly earnings $37.02 (+3.8% YoY) while ECI decelerating to 3.6% — high level, slowing growth
recent_signals.detail: Wages high in absolute terms even though growth moderates. Many knowledge tasks cost <$1/hr via AI vs $37/hr human. The P3 cost kill does not require accelerating wages — it requires that human labor stays expensive relative to agentic labor.

recent_signals.headline: JOLTS openings at 6,542K — down 12.9% YoY but still 20% above pre-pandemic normal (~5,500K)
recent_signals.detail: Labor market normalizing but remains structurally above 2019 levels. Decline concentrated in sectors where AI substitutes; shortage sectors remain persistently tight.

recent_signals.headline: Quits rate at 2.0% — workers frozen in place, creating zombie labor in declining sectors
recent_signals.detail: Low quits + declining sectors = workers staying with deteriorating employers. Incumbents staffed with demoralized, immobile workers — worst condition for competitive response to agentic entrant.

recent_signals.headline: 3,768 companies citing AI as risk factor in SEC filings — incumbents self-identifying as vulnerable
recent_signals.detail: Legally mandated disclosure. Volume (3,768) means AI disruption risk is mainstream in corporate risk assessment. These companies are self-identifying as P2 cascade candidates.

recent_signals.headline: Fed funds at 3.64%, down 169bps from peak — easing cycle favors agentic-first low-burn models
recent_signals.detail: Rates declining but still elevated. Favors cash-flow-positive, low-burn businesses. Sweet spot for asset-light agentic entrants.

recent_signals.headline: Transportation employment down -0.9% YoY (-58.5K) from Feb 2025 peak
recent_signals.detail: Logistics shedding workers while e-commerce grows. Decoupling of employment from output signals automation. Adjacent opportunity: agentic logistics coordination for remaining fragmented carriers.

recent_signals.headline: LLM API pricing commoditizing — multiple providers in price war, DeepSeek forcing compression
recent_signals.detail: Textbook infrastructure overhang. Providers commoditizing their own product, pushing returns to application layer.

recent_signals.headline: 10,000+ EDGAR hits for cost reduction AND automation — industrial-scale automation push confirmed
recent_signals.detail: Volume is the signal. Thousands of companies simultaneously pursuing cost reduction through automation. Creates demand for agentic tools while confirming labor cost pressure drives enterprise behavior.

recent_signals.headline: Financial Services employment flat +0.4% YoY (9,244K) — stagnant sector in pre-cascade phase
recent_signals.detail: Finance in maintenance mode. Insurance, mortgage processing, compliance, bookkeeping are sub-sectors most exposed to next phase of cascade.

recent_signals.headline: 24,039 business bankruptcy filings in 2025 (+5.6% YoY) with 117 large corporate bankruptcies
recent_signals.detail: Cascade confirmed across entire size spectrum. Small filings create acquisition opportunities at the scale relevant to $500K-1M startup.
